ccre.instinct

Class InstinctMultiModule

  • java.lang.Object
    • ccre.instinct.InstinctBaseModule
      • ccre.instinct.InstinctModule
        • ccre.instinct.InstinctMultiModule
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    EventOutput

    public class InstinctMultiModule
extends InstinctModule
    An easy way to have multiple autonomous modes. Simply register a series of InstinctModeModules with this.
    Author:
    skeggsc

      • publishDefaultControls

        public void publishDefaultControls(boolean showIndividualModes,
                          boolean showCycleChooser)
        Publish controls over Cluck to manipulate the current mode. These are a set of buttons that view or change them mode. By default, only "Autonomous Mode Check" will be published, which will log the current autonomous mode. This lets the driver know the current mode. If showIndividualModes is true, then each mode registered so far will get its own "Autonomous Mode: " button that will switch to that mode. If showCycleChooser is true, then "Autonomous Mode Next" and "Autonomous Mode Previous" will be published, which will cycle through the autonomous modes.
        Parameters:
        showIndividualModes - if the individual modes should have controls.
        showCycleChooser - if a cyclical selector should have controls.

      • loadSettings

        public void loadSettings(InstinctModeModule defaultMode)
        Load the default mode setting and any settings in any of the modes.
        Parameters:
        defaultMode - the mode to default to if there is no valid saved mode.

      • addMode

        public InstinctModeModule addMode(InstinctModeModule newMode)
                           throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Add the specified mode to this MultiModule.
        Parameters:
        newMode - the mode to add.
        Returns:
        the added mode.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the mode's name is already used.

      • addNullMode

        public InstinctModeModule addNullMode(java.lang.String name,
                             java.lang.String message)
        Add a "null mode" to this MultiModule. The null mode will have the given name and will do nothing but log a message when it runs. This could be "No mode selected" or something.
        Parameters:
        name - the null mode's name.
        message - the null mode's message.
        Returns:
        the newly created mode.
